thread.title: Ann Summers recalls vibrator over electric shock fears | London Evening Standard
thread.title_full: Ann Summers recalls vibrator over electric shock fears | London Evening Standard

author: Saphora Smith
title: Ann Summers recalls vibrator over electric shock fears | London Evening Standard
text:
Wednesday 8 February 2017 12:46 GMT Click to followThe Evening Standard Ann Summers: Recalls Black Wand Vibrator Getty Images 
Sex shop Ann Summers has recalled a popular vibrator over concerns that "prolonged use" may expose its wires, potentially giving an electric shock. 
The store said the recall was precautionary but they had received some complaints concerning exposed wires in the cord of the Black Power Wand vibrator. 
Ann Summers displayed notices in shop windows this week advising customers with a Black Power Wand to contact customer services and said all online customers had been contacted by the retailer. 
The store said customers would be reimbursed and the vibrator is no longer available to buy online. 
Director of marketing, Cathy Reid, said: â€œThe safety of our customers is always at the heart of everything we do here at Ann Summers. Man 'tried to have sex with drain cover' 
"Whilst the Black Power Wand complies with all necessary safety testing standards and legal regulations, we have made a voluntary decision to recall the product from all channels in November 2016 due to a very small number of isolated reports concerning the wires in the cord of the Black Power Wand. 
"Our product development team have been working closely with trading standards, who are fully aware and supportive of the precautionary recall." 
"We continue to ensure all customers affected are reimbursed with a full refund and our customer care teams are available to answer any concerns or queries," she said. More about:
